document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Alysia Latreille (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Alysiinae), with description of six new species from China

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 21. Alysia macrops Wharton, ♀, China (Zhejiang), habitus, lateral aspect.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 22. Alysia macrops Wharton, ♀, China (Zhejiang), A, wings; B, mesosoma, lateral aspect; C, mesosoma, dorsal aspect; D, propodeum, first and second metasomal tergites, dorsal aspect; E, propodeum and metasoma, dorsal aspect; F, basal segments of antenna, lateral aspect; G, ovipositor and ovipositor sheath, lateral aspect; H, head, dorsal aspect; I, head, anterior aspect; J, head, lateral aspect; K, mandible, full view on first and second teeth; L, mandible, full view on third tooth; M, hind leg, lateral aspect.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 21.
Alysia macrops Wharton
, ♀, China (Zhejiang), habitus, lateral aspect.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description .
♀ , Length of body 4.4 mm , of fore wing 4.5 mm .

Variation. Males are similar to females, body length of ♂ 3.2–3.5 mm ; of fore wing 3.3–3.6 mm ; antennal segments of ♂ 34 (1). Females have body length 3.4–4.4 mm , and length of fore wing 3.3–4.5 mm , eye in dorsal view 2.3–2.7 × as long as temple; face 1.5–1.7 × wider than high, antennal segments of ♀ 33(1), 34(1), 35(1), 36(1), 37(2), 38 (1) or 39(1).
